channel.title: Springfield: The Later Years
channel.description:
There are few things as hollowed for Simpsons fans as Seasons 2-11. The pinnacle, the Golden Era, the cromulent core of a show beloved by many. However, what happens when two Simpsons superfans journey a little, well… a lot later into the Simpsons canon? Welcome to Springfield: The Later Years. Join long time friends, Patrick Brennan and Craig Mazerolle, as they dive into seasons 24 to the present day of The Simpsons. Each episode, the boys will go where few Simpsons fans have dared to explore to see what stands up and what stinks.
New Episodes every Monday!
channel.copyright: © 2018 Springfield: The Later Years. Part of the Station Zed Empire.
channel.itunes:subtitle: Two Simpsons fans put their love of the show to the test

item.title: 051 – Hellscape
item.dc:creator: Springfield - The Later Years
item.description:
“Treehouse of Horror XXIX” (Season 30, Episode 4)

Halloween in August!? It happened…and unfortunately it hasn’t worked out the way Craig and Pat hoped it would.

Hosted by Patrick Brennan and Craig Mazerolle
Research by Craig Mazerolle
Produced by Patrick Brennan
Logo by Stephen Belyea
Featuring audio clips from The Simpsons, as well as a guy playing the theme to Jurassic Park on a melodica.
Theme – “Children’s TV 2” by Dorian Kelly

item.title: 046 – Dirty Daniel (S: 1, E:1)
item.dc:creator: Springfield - The Later Years
item.description:
“Mr. Irresistible” (Season 1, Episode 1)

This is a weird one, folks. In an effort to cleanse their pallets of the Simpsons stinkers they’ve recently encountered, Pat and Craig thought it would be funny to take a look at the first episode of the ill-begotten Michael Richards Show. And it was funny alright, but not “Ha-Ha” funny. Strap yourselves in for a bumpy one!

Hosted by Patrick Brennan and Craig Mazerolle
Research by Craig Mazerolle
Produced by Patrick Brennan
Logo by Stephen Belyea
Featuring audio clips from the Michael Richards Show episode Mr. Irresistible”.
Theme – “Children’s TV 2” by Dorian Kelly

item.description:

After last week’s stinker and dark contemplations, Pat and Craig turn to alcohol to make it through their next outing. And wouldn’t you just know it: this crossover episode is actually amazing! Isn’t that always the way?

Research by Craig Mazerolle
Produced by Patrick Brennan
Logo by Stephen Belyea
Featuring audio clips from The Simpsons episode “Simpsorama”, a commercial for “Tombstone Pizza”, and the theme (sorta) to “Futurama”.
Theme – “Children’s TV 2” by Dorian Kelly

item.googleplay:description: “The Musk Who Fell To Earth” (Season 26, Episode 12) Craig and Pat begin their (foolhardy?) exploration of the later years of “The Simpsons” with an episode featuring one of the strangest celebrity cameos the good folks of Springfield have ever seen. Hosted by Patrick Brennan and Craig Mazerolle Research by Craig Mazerolle Produced by Patrick Brennan Logo by Stephen Belyea Theme – “Children’s TV 2” by Dorian Kelly
